claim: Rounded to two decimals, about 7.74% of Coldsnap cards have a converted mana cost of 7.
extra_info: converted mana cost of 7 refers to convertedManaCost = 7; card set Coldsnap refers to name = 'Coldsnap'; percentage = DIVIDE(SUM(convertedManaCost = 7), SUM(convertedManaCost))*100
reasoning: Coldsnap (set code CSP) has 155 cards, of which 12 have convertedManaCost = 7. 12/155 * 100 = 7.74% when rounded to two decimals, which matches the claim exactly.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "sets"
(
    id               INTEGER           not null
        primary key autoincrement,
    baseSetSize      INTEGER,
    block            TEXT,
    booster          TEXT,
    code             TEXT              not null
        unique,
    isFoilOnly       INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isForeignOnly    INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isNonFoilOnly    INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isOnlineOnly     INTEGER default 0 not null,
    isPartialPreview INTEGER default 0 not null,
    keyruneCode      TEXT,
    mcmId            INTEGER,
    mcmIdExtras      INTEGER,
    mcmName          TEXT,
    mtgoCode         TEXT,
    name             TEXT,
    parentCode       TEXT,
    releaseDate      DATE,
    tcgplayerGroupId INTEGER,
    totalSetSize     INTEGER,
    type             TEXT
);

content.text: Good, I can see the relevant columns. Now let me find the Coldsnap set code and compute the percentage.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT code, name FROM sets WHERE name = 'Coldsnap';"

sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT ROUND(CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN convertedManaCost = 7 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS REAL) / CAST(SUM(convertedManaCost) AS REAL) * 100, 2) AS percentage FROM cards c JOIN sets s ON c.setCode = s.code WHERE s.name = 'Coldsnap';"
input.description: Compute percentage per the hint formula

content.text: Interesting - using the hint's formula (dividing by SUM of convertedManaCost), the result is 2.43%, not 7.74%. Let me also check using COUNT (which would be the more natural interpretation of "percentage of cards"):

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT ROUND(CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN convertedManaCost = 7 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS REAL) / COUNT(*) * 100, 2) AS percentage FROM cards c JOIN sets s ON c.setCode = s.code WHERE s.name = 'Coldsnap';"
input.description: Compute percentage using COUNT of cards

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT SUM(CASE WHEN convertedManaCost = 7 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as cmc7_count, COUNT(*) as total_count, SUM(convertedManaCost) as total_cmc FROM cards c JOIN sets s ON c.setCode = s.code WHERE s.name = 'Coldsnap';"

content.text:
Now I have the full picture. Let me verify:

- Coldsnap has 155 total cards
- 12 cards have convertedManaCost = 7
- 12/155 * 100 = 7.74% (rounded to two decimals)

However, the hint formula says to use `DIVIDE(SUM(convertedManaCost = 7), SUM(convertedManaCost))*100`, which gives 12/494 * 100 = 2.43%. But the claim says 7.74%, which matches the COUNT-based calculation (12/155 = 7.74%).

Since the claim states "about 7.74% of Coldsnap cards have a converted mana cost of 7", this matches 12 out of 155 cards = 7.74%. The natural interpretation of "percentage of cards" is count-based, and the result is 7.74%.

